name: cursor
description: The type of cursor to be displayed for the pointing device
longDescription: This property specifies the type of cursor to be displayed for the pointing device.

<uri>.description: The user agent retrieves the cursor from the resource designated by the URI. If the user agent cannot handle the first cursor of a list of cursors, it must attempt to handle the second, etc. If the user agent cannot handle any user-defined cursor, it must use the cursor keyword at the end of the list. The optional <x> and <y> coordinates identify the exact position within the image which is the pointer position (i.e., the hotspot).

<x>.description: The x-coordinate of the position in the cursor's coordinate system (left/top relative) which represents the precise position that is being pointed to.

<y>.description: The y-coordinate of the position in the cursor's coordinate system (left/top relative) which represents the precise position that is being pointed to.

values.alias: Indicates an alias of/shortcut to something is to be created. Often rendered as an arrow with a small curved arrow next to it.
values.all-scroll: Indicates that the something can be scrolled in any direction. Often rendered as arrows pointing up, down, left, and right with a dot in the middle.
values.auto: The UA determines the cursor to display based on the current context.
values.cell: Indicates that a cell or set of cells may be selected. Often rendered as a thick plus-sign with a dot in the middle.
values.context-menu: A context menu is available for the object under the cursor. Often rendered as an arrow with a small menu-like graphic next to it.
values.copy: Indicates something is to be copied. Often rendered as an arrow with a small plus sign next to it.
values.col-resize: Indicates that the item/column can be resized horizontally. Often rendered as arrows pointing left and right with a vertical bar separating them.
values.crosshair: A simple crosshair (e.g., short line segments resembling a "+" sign). Often used to indicate a two dimensional bitmap selection mode.
values.default: The platform-dependent default cursor. Often rendered as an arrow.
values.help: Help is available for the object under the cursor. Often rendered as a question mark or a balloon.
values.move: Indicates something is to be moved.
values.no-drop: Indicates that the dragged item cannot be dropped at the current cursor location. Often rendered as a hand or pointer with a small circle with a line through it.
values.none: No cursor is rendered for the element.
values.not-allowed: Indicates that the requested action will not be carried out. Often rendered as a circle with a line through it.
values.pointer: The cursor is a pointer that indicates a link.
values.progress: A progress indicator. The program is performing some processing, but is different from wait in that the user may still interact with the program. Often rendered as a spinning beach ball, or an arrow with a watch or hourglass.
values.row-resize: Indicates that the item/row can be resized vertically. Often rendered as arrows pointing up and down with a horizontal bar separating them.
values.text: Indicates text that may be selected. Often rendered as a vertical I-beam. User agents may automatically display a horizontal I-beam/cursor (e.g. same as the vertical-text keyword) for vertical text, or for that matter, any angle of I-beam/cursor for text that is rendered at any particular angle.
values.vertical-text: Indicates vertical-text that may be selected. Often rendered as a horizontal I-beam.
values.wait: Indicates that the program is busy and the user should wait. Often rendered as a watch or hourglass.
values.n-resize: Indicates that the north edge is to be moved.
values.w-resize: Indicates that the west edge is to be moved.
values.s-resize: Indicates that the south edge is to be moved.
values.e-resize: Indicates that the east edge is to be moved.
values.nw-resize: Indicates that the north-west corner is to be moved.
values.ne-resize: Indicates that the north-east corner is to be moved.
values.sw-resize: Indicates that the south-west corner is to be moved.
values.se-resize: Indicates that the south-east corner is to be moved.
